briefdescription.para: Typename for the model details data structure vrna_md_s.
Rescale energy parameters to a temperature in degC.

detaileddescription.para: Default is 37C. You have to call the update_..._params() functions after changing this parameter.

xrefdescription.para: Use vrna_md_defaults_temperature(), and vrna_md_defaults_temperature_get() to change, and read the global default temperature settings

briefdescription.para: A scaling factor used by pf_fold() to avoid overflows.

detaileddescription.para: Should be set to approximately $exp{((-F/kT)/length)}$, where $F$ is an estimate for the ensemble free energy, for example the minimum free energy. You must call update_pf_params() after changing this parameter. If pf_scale is -1 (the default) , an estimate will be provided automatically when computing partition functions, e.g. pf_fold() The automatic estimate is usually insufficient for sequences more than a few hundred bases long.

briefdescription.para: Switch the energy model for dangling end contributions (0, 1, 2, 3)

detaileddescription.para: If set to 0 no stabilizing energies are assigned to bases adjacent to helices in free ends and multiloops (so called dangling ends). Normally (dangles = 1) dangling end energies are assigned only to unpaired bases and a base cannot participate simultaneously in two dangling ends. In the partition function algorithm pf_fold() these checks are neglected. If dangles is set to 2, all folding routines will follow this convention. This treatment of dangling ends gives more favorable energies to helices directly adjacent to one another, which can be beneficial since such helices often do engage in stabilizing interactions through co-axial stacking. If dangles = 3 co-axial stacking is explicitly included for adjacent helices in multiloops. The option affects only mfe folding and energy evaluation (fold() and energy_of_structure()), as well as suboptimal folding (subopt()) via re-evaluation of energies. Co-axial stacking with one intervening mismatch is not considered so far.
Default is 2 in most algorithms, partition function algorithms can only handle 0 and 2

briefdescription.para: Include special stabilizing energies for some tri-, tetra- and hexa-loops;.
Global switch to avoid/allow helices of length 1.

detaileddescription.para: Disallow all pairs which can only occur as lonely pairs (i.e. as helix of length 1). This avoids lonely base pairs in the predicted structures in most cases.

briefdescription.para: Global switch to forbid/allow GU base pairs at all.
GU allowed only inside stacks if set to 1.
backward compatibility variable.. this does not effect anything
Allow G-quadruplex formation.
do ML decomposition uniquely (for subopt)
0 = BP; 1=any with GC; 2=any with AU-parameter

detaileddescription.para: If set to 1 or 2: fold sequences from an artificial alphabet ABCD..., where A pairs B, C pairs D, etc. using either GC (1) or AU parameters (2); default is 0, you probably don't want to change it.

briefdescription.para: do backtracking, i.e. compute secondary structures or base pair probabilities

detaileddescription.para: If 0, do not calculate pair probabilities in pf_fold(); this is about twice as fast. Default is 1.

briefdescription.para: A backtrack array marker for inverse_fold()

detaileddescription.para: If set to 'C': force (1,N) to be paired, 'M' fold as if the sequence were inside a multiloop. Otherwise ('F') the usual mfe structure is computed.

briefdescription.para: contains allowed non standard base pairs

detaileddescription.para: Lists additional base pairs that will be allowed to form in addition to GC, CG, AU, UA, GU and UG. Nonstandard base pairs are given a stacking energy of 0.

briefdescription.para: Maximum allowed base pair span.

detaileddescription.para: A value of -1 indicates no restriction for distant base pairs.

briefdescription.para: use old alifold energies (with gaps)
use ribosum matrices
if nonzero use logarithmic ML energy in energy_of_struct
salt concentration
Salt correction for duplex initialization.
Apply default model details to a provided vrna_md_t data structure.

detaileddescription.para: Use this function to initialize a vrna_md_t data structure with its default values

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the data structure that is about to be initialized

briefdescription.para: Update the model details data structure.

detaileddescription.para: This function should be called after changing the vrna_md_t.energy_set attribute since it re-initializes base pairing related arrays within the vrna_md_t data structure. In particular, vrna_md_t.pair, vrna_md_t.alias, and vrna_md_t.rtype are set to the values that correspond to the specified vrna_md_t.energy_set option

simplesect.para: vrna_md_t, vrna_md_t.energy_set, vrna_md_t.pair, vrna_md_t.rtype, vrna_md_t.alias, vrna_md_set_default()

briefdescription.para: Copy/Clone a vrna_md_t model.

detaileddescription.para: Use this function to clone a given model either inplace (target container md_to given) or create a copy by cloning the source model and returning it (md_to == NULL).

parameterdescription.para: The model to be overwritten (if non-NULL and md_to != md_from)

simplesect.para: A pointer to the copy model (or NULL if md_from == NULL)

briefdescription.para: Get a corresponding commandline parameter string of the options in a vrna_md_t.
Reset the global default model details to a specific set of parameters, or their initial values.

detaileddescription.para: This function resets the global default model details to their initial values, i.e. as specified by the ViennaRNA Package release, upon passing NULL as argument. Alternatively it resets them according to a set of provided parameters.

simplesect.para: The global default parameters affect all function calls of RNAlib where model details are not explicitly provided. Hence, any change of them is not considered threadsafe
This function first resets the global default settings to factory defaults, and only then applies user provided settings (if any). User settings that do not meet specifications are skipped.

parameterdescription.para: A set of model details to use as global default (if NULL is passed, factory defaults are restored)

briefdescription.para: Set default temperature for energy evaluation of loops.
Get default temperature for energy evaluation of loops.

simplesect.para: The global default settings for temperature in centigrade

briefdescription.para: Set default scaling factor of thermodynamic temperature in Boltzmann factors.

detaileddescription.para: Bolzmann factors are then computed as $ exp(-E / (b \cdot kT))$.

briefdescription.para: Get default scaling factor of thermodynamic temperature in Boltzmann factors.

simplesect.para: The global default thermodynamic temperature scaling factor

briefdescription.para: Set default dangle model for structure prediction.
Get default dangle model for structure prediction.

simplesect.para: The global default settings for the dangle model

briefdescription.para: Set default behavior for lookup of tabulated free energies for special hairpin loops, such as Tri-, Tetra-, or Hexa-loops.
Get default behavior for lookup of tabulated free energies for special hairpin loops, such as Tri-, Tetra-, or Hexa-loops.

simplesect.para: The global default settings for the treatment of special hairpin loops

briefdescription.para: Set default behavior for prediction of canonical secondary structures.
Get default behavior for prediction of canonical secondary structures.

simplesect.para: The global default settings for predicting canonical secondary structures

briefdescription.para: Set default behavior for treatment of G-U wobble pairs.
Get default behavior for treatment of G-U wobble pairs.

simplesect.para: The global default settings for treatment of G-U wobble pairs

briefdescription.para: Set default behavior for G-U pairs as closing pair for loops.
Get default behavior for G-U pairs as closing pair for loops.

simplesect.para: The global default settings for treatment of G-U pairs closing a loop

briefdescription.para: Set default behavior recomputing free energies of multi-branch loops using a logarithmic model.
Get default behavior recomputing free energies of multi-branch loops using a logarithmic model.

simplesect.para: The global default settings for logarithmic model in multi-branch loop free energy evaluation

briefdescription.para: Set default behavior whether input sequences are circularized.
Get default behavior whether input sequences are circularized.

simplesect.para: The global default settings for treating input sequences as circular

briefdescription.para: Set default behavior for treatment of G-Quadruplexes.
Get default behavior for treatment of G-Quadruplexes.

simplesect.para: The global default settings for treatment of G-Quadruplexes

briefdescription.para: Set default behavior for creating additional matrix for unique multi-branch loop prediction.

simplesect.para: Activating this option usually results in higher memory consumption!

briefdescription.para: Get default behavior for creating additional matrix for unique multi-branch loop prediction.

simplesect.para: The global default settings for creating additional matrices for unique multi-branch loop prediction

briefdescription.para: Set default energy set.
Get default energy set.

simplesect.para: The global default settings for the energy set

briefdescription.para: Set default behavior for whether to backtrack secondary structures.
Get default behavior for whether to backtrack secondary structures.

simplesect.para: The global default settings for backtracking structures

briefdescription.para: Set default backtrack type, i.e. which DP matrix is used.
Get default backtrack type, i.e. which DP matrix is used.

simplesect.para: The global default settings that specify which DP matrix is used for backtracking

briefdescription.para: Set the default behavior for whether to compute base pair probabilities after partition function computation.
Get the default behavior for whether to compute base pair probabilities after partition function computation.

simplesect.para: The global default settings that specify whether base pair probabilities are computed together with partition function

briefdescription.para: Set default maximal base pair span.
Get default maximal base pair span.

simplesect.para: The global default settings for maximum base pair span

briefdescription.para: Set default minimal loop size.

parameterdescription.para: Minimal size, i.e. number of unpaired nucleotides for a hairpin loop

briefdescription.para: Get default minimal loop size.

simplesect.para: The global default settings for minimal size of hairpin loops

briefdescription.para: Set default window size for sliding window structure prediction approaches.

parameterdescription.para: The size of the sliding window

briefdescription.para: Get default window size for sliding window structure prediction approaches.

simplesect.para: The global default settings for the size of the sliding window

briefdescription.para: Set default behavior for whether to use old energy model for comparative structure prediction.

simplesect.para: This option is outdated. Activating the old energy model usually results in worse consensus structure predictions.

briefdescription.para: Get default behavior for whether to use old energy model for comparative structure prediction.

simplesect.para: The global default settings for using old energy model for comparative structure prediction

briefdescription.para: Set default behavior for whether to use Ribosum Scoring in comparative structure prediction.
Get default behavior for whether to use Ribosum Scoring in comparative structure prediction.

simplesect.para: The global default settings for using Ribosum scoring in comparative structure prediction

briefdescription.para: Set the default co-variance scaling factor used in comparative structure prediction.
Get the default co-variance scaling factor used in comparative structure prediction.

simplesect.para: The global default settings for the co-variance factor

briefdescription.para: Set the default scaling factor used to avoid under-/overflows in partition function computation.
Get the default scaling factor used to avoid under-/overflows in partition function computation.

simplesect.para: The global default settings of the scaling factor

briefdescription.para: Set the default salt concentration.
Get the default salt concentration.
Set the default multiloop size lower bound for loop salt correciton linear fitting.

parameterdescription.para: Size lower bound (number of backbone in loop)

briefdescription.para: Get the default multiloop size lower bound for loop salt correciton linear fitting.
Set the default multiloop size upper bound for loop salt correciton linear fitting.

parameterdescription.para: Size Upper bound (number of backbone in loop)

briefdescription.para: Get the default multiloop size upper bound for loop salt correciton linear fitting.
Set user-provided salt correciton for duplex initialization If value is 99999 the default value from fitting is used.

parameterdescription.para: The value of salt correction for duplex initialization (in dcal/mol)

briefdescription.para: Get user-provided salt correciton for duplex initialization If value is 99999 the default value from fitting is used.

simplesect.para: The user-provided salt correction for duplex initialization

briefdescription.para: Set default model details.

detaileddescription.para: Use this function if you wish to initialize a vrna_md_t data structure with its default values, i.e. the global model settings as provided by the deprecated global variables.

xrefdescription.para: This function will vanish as soon as backward compatibility of RNAlib is dropped (expected in version 3). Use vrna_md_set_default() instead!

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the data structure that is about to be initialized

para.htmlonly: Default temperature for structure prediction and free energy evaluation in &#176C
para.latexonly: Default temperature for structure prediction and free energy evaluation in $^\circ C$

briefdescription.para: Default scaling factor for partition function computations.
Default scaling factor for absolute thermodynamic temperature in Boltzmann factors.
Default dangling end model.
Default model behavior for lookup of special tri-, tetra-, and hexa-loops.
Default model behavior for so-called 'lonely pairs'.
Default model behavior for G-U base pairs.
Default model behavior for G-U base pairs closing a loop.
Default model behavior to treat a molecule as a circular RNA (DNA)
Default model behavior regarding the treatment of G-Quadruplexes.
Default behavior of the model regarding unique multi-branch loop decomposition.
Default model behavior on which energy set to use.
Default model behavior with regards to backtracking of structures.
Default model behavior on what type of backtracking to perform.
Default model behavior with regards to computing base pair probabilities.
Default model behavior for the allowed maximum base pair span.
Default model behavior for the sliding window approach.
Default model behavior on how to evaluate the energy contribution of multi-branch loops.
Default model behavior for consensus structure energy evaluation.
Default model behavior for consensus structure co-variance contribution assessment.
Default model behavior for weighting the co-variance score in consensus structure prediction.
Default model behavior for weighting the nucleotide conservation? in consensus structure prediction.
Default model salt concentration (M)
Default model lower bound of multiloop size for salt correction fiting.
Default model upper bound of multiloop size for salt correction fiting.
Default model value to turn off user-provided salt correction for duplex initializtion.
Default helical rise.
Default backbone length.
Maximal length of alphabet.
